summary: Successful third thrust chamber assembly test at DLR Lampoldshausen, achieving 140 seconds of power, with a total of 270 seconds of reuse on the same injector plate, advancing towards the #S1B flight. [cite: 1, 2, 3, 4]

Announcement of the internal development and manufacturing of Sirius' first test bench, a strategic asset to accelerate in-house testing and qualification of their propulsion systems. [cite: 9, 10, 11]

Recapping combustion chamber test progression to 140 seconds at full thrust in April 2025[cite: 19], and announcing a timeline for a full engine test by the end of the year and the first ballistic flight of #Sirius1 by the end of 2026.
Launch of the hiring process for a Mission Manager to handle client satellites, marking the beginning of the commercialization of the Sirius Modular Launch Service. [cite: 23, 24, 25]
Report on a visit from a CNES delegation, led by President Lionel Suchet, to their Ile-de-France sites to reaffirm their technical and institutional partnership. [cite: 32, 33, 34]
The CEO and Founder, Antoine Fourcade, was selected for the Forbes France #30under30 list for the 2025 edition. [cite: 39]
Announcing participation in the Space Symposium in Colorado Springs from April 7-10, 2025, at the CNES Booth 403, to discuss their #SIRIUS launch service. [cite: 50, 51]
Following participation at #Globallndustrie 2025, Sirius highlights its industrial ramp-up, projecting that by the end of 2025, 40% of its team will be in production. [cite: 53, 56]
Announcing their presence at GLOBAL INDUSTRIE 2025 (March 11-14), where CEO Antoine Fourcade will speak on March 13th about French deeptech excellence for European sovereignty. [cite: 65, 69]
Announcing their participation at the SATELLITE 2025 conference in the U.S. from March 10-13 to promote their reliable, flexible, and sustainable launch services. [cite: 73, 74]
Recruitment announcement for a Technical Lead GNC (Guidance, Navigation & Control) based in Colombes, France, with an application deadline of March 18, 2025. [cite: 79, 80]
Participation at TECH&FEST 2025 (Feb 5-6) in Grenoble, showcasing their combustion chamber tested in October and featuring CEO Antoine Fourcade in a roundtable discussion. [cite: 81, 83, 84, 86]
Announcing the upcoming testing phase for their in-house developed turbopump at the DLR facility in Lampoldshausen, a key step towards STAR-1 engine validation. [cite: 88, 89]
Sirius Space Services received an award in the industry category at the France 2030 ceremony organized by the Prefecture des Hauts-de-Seine. [cite: 90, 91]
Report on a visit from the CNES Governance Team at the end of 2024 to review milestones, discuss 2025 objectives, and reinforce their long-standing partnership. [cite: 97, 98]
Co-founder Antoine Fourcade is featured in the #GOnext selection by #GOEntrepreneurs as one of 20 rising stars in French entrepreneurship. [cite: 101, 102]

Announcing their participation in a space launcher exhibition at Chateau de Ladoucette, Drancy (Dec 7, 2024 - Feb 9, 2025), where their 100% in-house designed STAR-1 combustion chamber will be displayed. [cite: 105, 106]
Successful first test campaign of their in-house turbopump at DLR Lampoldshausen on January 17, reaching 45,000 rpm, a key step towards full-scale STAR-1 #FullEngine tests. [cite: 111, 112, 116]
Celebrating the milestone of reaching 10,000 followers on their LinkedIn page. [cite: 119]

Report on a visit from the Vice-President of Région Ile-de-France, highlighting team growth to over 80 employees and plans for industrialization in 2025 ahead of the SIRIUS 1 ballistic flight in 2026. [cite: 122, 129, 131]
Happy New Year 2025 wishes to their community, noting that the year is exciting as they move closer to the maiden flight of Sirius 1. [cite: 136, 137]

Announcing a multi-year, multi-launch partnership with Equatorial Launch Australia (ELA) to operate from the Arnhem Space Centre, starting with the Sirius 1 ballistic flight in Australia in 2026. [cite: 138, 145, 146]

Launch of a new video series, "Sirius Connect," with the first episode for #SemaineDeLIndustrie focusing on women in the space industry, featuring three of their female engineers. [cite: 156, 157, 159]
Repost from La French Fab featuring a guessing game about an innovation showcased at their shared booth during a tech event.

Successful engine chamber test at DLR Lampoldshausen on October 8, 2024, with two 60-second full-thrust hot-fire tests, setting the stage for a full-scale engine test in Q2-2025. [cite: 161, 162, 165]

Highlighting manufacturing progress, achieving 120 seconds of thrust in two years, and reiterating plans for a full engine test in 2025 and Sirius 1's first ballistic flight in late 2026. [cite: 171, 175]
A retrospective thank-you post following their participation in Viva Technology 2024, acknowledging partners like Bpifrance, government supporters, and their team. [cite: 176, 177, 180]
Celebrating team growth to over 100 employees and the successful validation of their Preliminary Design Review (PDR), moving closer to a first flight in 2026. [cite: 184, 186, 187]

Announcing their integration into the ACI GROUP's MAGMA Tech & Factory program to industrialize launcher production, with a timeline for inaugural flights of SIRIUS 1 (S1 2026), SIRIUS 13 (S2 2026), and SIRIUS 15 (mid-2027). [cite: 189, 200]
Announcing a partnership with Marsh France, a global leader in insurance broking and risk management, to define and implement their space insurance strategy. [cite: 203]
CEO Antoine Fourcade reflects on his participation and entrepreneurial story at the Bpifrance events "La Deeptech voit BIG" and "BIG 2024". [cite: 209, 210]
Highlighting a feature in Le Parisien about their pilot factory near Paris and the start of industrialization for the new iteration of their #STAR engine. [cite: 216, 217, 218]

Announcing the successful validation of the Preliminary Design Review (PDR) for the Sirius launcher range, officially launching the development phase and strengthening their partnership with CNES. [cite: 221]
Holiday greetings for the end of 2024 and a thank you to the team, partners, and supporters. [cite: 225, 231]

Announcing a partnership with HALCYON PERFORMANCE to co-develop an aluminum sandwich fairing for #SIRIUS1 Balistique, with separation tests in 2025 and manufacturing finalized in H1 2025. [cite: 237, 239, 240]
Announcing a partnership with CMP Composites, initiated in July 2024, to develop advanced composite carbon tanks and skirts for their launcher's second stage. [cite: 242, 249]

Announcing their attendance at Space Tech Expo Europe 2024 (Nov 19-21) in Bremen, where they will exhibit the latest iteration of their combustion chamber, successfully tested in October 2024. [cite: 253, 254]
Teaser for a major announcement to be made on October 16th at the 75th International Astronautical Congress (IAC) in Milan, in the presence of the CNES Chairman & CEO. [cite: 257, 258]
Announcing their presence and team members attending the 75th International Astronautical Congress (IAC2024) in Milan from October 14-18 at the France booth. [cite: 259, 260, 261, 266]

Announcing participation in the World Space Business Week 2024 (Sept 16-20) in Paris, with their CTO, Francois Maroquene Froissart, speaking on a panel about "Next Gen Access to Space Suppliers" on Sept 18th. [cite: 272]
Announcing attendance at the Toulouse Space Forum on Sept 10, 2024, where they are nominated for an "Etoile Montante" award and their CEO will speak on a panel about mini-launchers. [cite: 275]
